text: Intimidation is intentional behavior by a person that has another (or others) in fear of injury or harm. ==Threatening== Threatening (or more specifically: threatening actions/behavior) is the crime of when one, when knowing or with any intent, puts someone else in danger of bodily, emotional, intellectual/cognitive, sexual or financial harm or negative. Threats also include property damage, intent/planning to terrorize others and hating/condemning people of particular genders, races or ethnicity classes. ==Legal status== Intimidating another person is a crime in several states in the U.S. Intimidation related to hate, prejudice or discrimination often includes the following: ==References== Category:Law Category:Abuse Category:Types of crime
